title: Practice Challenge: Safe Array Operations
description:
You're building a leaderboard. Use modern array methods to sort and display scores WITHOUT modifying the original data.

1. Display the top 3 scores (highest first) using toSorted()
2. Get the last place score using at()
3. Remove the player at index 2 using toSpliced() and show the new list
instructions: Use toSorted(), at(), and toSpliced() to work with the data safely.

hints.text: For descending sort: toSorted((a, b) => b.score - a.score)
Chain .slice(0, 3) after toSorted() to get top 3

commonMistakes.correction: Always use toSorted() when you need to preserve the original
